definition: to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
clear/open/exempt (from)/liberal-minded
opening/stake all/sacrifice/crack/slit
to play Chinese finger-guessing game

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: My girlfriend and I are taking the plunge.
sentences.chinese: 我女朋友和我豁出去了。

sentences.english: I'll shoot the works this time by giving you a treat in a five-star hotel.
sentences.chinese: 这次我也豁出去了，到五星级大饭店请你们吃一顿。

sentences.english: Harshire is risking everything by coming here.
sentences.chinese: 哈什尔来这里把一切都豁出去了。

sentences.english: Indeed, he began to toy with the idea of going for broke .
sentences.chinese: 实际上他还开始开玩笑似地谈到豁出去干一场的念头。

sentences.english: But this year, in her final season, Oprah's going all out.
sentences.chinese: 但是今年，在最后一季，欧普拉打算豁出去了。

sentences.english: Throw caution to the wind, in case of failure, we just start from scratch again.
sentences.chinese: 豁出去了，要真的失败了，我们大不了从头开始。

sentences.english: Throwing caution to the wind, he decided to ride his motorcycle without a helmet.
sentences.chinese: 他决定豁出去了，不带安全帽就骑摩托。

definition: lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to succeed or die trying (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 cheng2 gong1 bian4 cheng2 ren2

definition: lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
to brave it out/to the bitter end
to fight with all one has
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to pledge one's life
go to hell!/drop dead!
win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine
pinyin: cheng2 bai4 zai4 ci3 yi1 ju3

definition: to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
to deserve praise for one's courage (idiom)
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
as matters stand/things having reached this stage
determined/unshakable
